title: How to Make Chicago Style Pizza

steps.headline: Pour 1 1/2 cups (355.5 ml) of warm water into a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: The water should be at a temperature of 110 °F (43.3 °C) (43.3 C).

steps.headline: Add 1 package of active dry yeast and 1 tsp.
steps.description: (5 g) of sugar to the warm water, stir to combine, and leave for about 5 minutes until the mixture begins to foam.

steps.headline: Place 1 1/2 cups (338 g) of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup (113 g) of semolina flour, 1/2 cup (118.5 ml) of vegetable oil and 1 tsp.
steps.description: (5 g) of salt into the yeast mixture in the bowl once it had foamed.

steps.headline: Combine all of the ingredients using your hands until there are no major lumps of flour, yeast or salt.
Add the remaining 2 cups (454 g) of all-purpose flour slowly while using your hands to work it into the dough, until you form a cohesive ball that is only a bit sticky.
Place the dough onto a flat, floured surface and begin to knead it until it is smooth and less sticky.
steps.description: The kneading process should take about 3 to 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Rub some oil around the inside of a large mixing bowl, coating it evenly.
Place the ball of dough into the oiled bowl and turn it to coat it evenly with oil, and then cover the bowl with a layer of plastic wrap and place it in a warm place for 1 to 1 1/2 hours to rise.
Remove the dough from the bowl when its size has doubled after an hour and divide it into 2 equal pieces.
Turn on the oven to heat at 475 °F (246 °C) (240 C).
Place a ball of dough into the center of the pan, and begin to press and stretch it to fill the bottom of the pan and work it 1/2 in.
steps.description: (1.3 cm) up the side of the pan on all sides.

steps.headline: Leave the dough to rest in the pan for 5 minutes.
Place a layer of mozzarella cheese across the bottom of the pizza, then top with tomato sauce.
Add any of your preferred pizza toppings over the tomato sauce, then place in the oven for 30 minutes.
Let cool for a few minutes and then serve.

text: Pour 1 1/2 cups (355.5 ml) of warm water into a large mixing bowl. The water should be at a temperature of 110 °F (43.3 °C) (43.3 C). Add 1 package of active dry yeast and 1 tsp. (5 g) of sugar to the warm water, stir to combine, and leave for about 5 minutes until the mixture begins to foam. Place 1 1/2 cups (338 g) of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup (113 g) of semolina flour, 1/2 cup (118.5 ml) of vegetable oil and 1 tsp. (5 g) of salt into the yeast mixture in the bowl once it had foamed. Combine all of the ingredients using your hands until there are no major lumps of flour, yeast or salt.  Add the remaining 2 cups (454 g) of all-purpose flour slowly while using your hands to work it into the dough, until you form a cohesive ball that is only a bit sticky.  Place the dough onto a flat, floured surface and begin to knead it until it is smooth and less sticky. The kneading process should take about 3 to 5 minutes. Rub some oil around the inside of a large mixing bowl, coating it evenly.  Place the ball of dough into the oiled bowl and turn it to coat it evenly with oil, and then cover the bowl with a layer of plastic wrap and place it in a warm place for 1 to 1 1/2 hours to rise.  Remove the dough from the bowl when its size has doubled after an hour and divide it into 2 equal pieces.  Turn on the oven to heat at 475 °F (246 °C) (240 C).  Oil a 12-in. (30.5cm) deep-dish pizza pan. Place a ball of dough into the center of the pan, and begin to press and stretch it to fill the bottom of the pan and work it 1/2 in. (1.3 cm) up the side of the pan on all sides. Leave the dough to rest in the pan for 5 minutes.  Place a layer of mozzarella cheese across the bottom of the pizza, then top with tomato sauce.  Add any of your preferred pizza toppings over the tomato sauce, then place in the oven for 30 minutes.  Let cool for a few minutes and then serve.
